results.title: Gangs
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated work relates the story of a young naive boy’s horrific beating by a vicious student from his school. The young boy calls his older brother - a member of a gang, to avenge his beating. The older brother gathers up his friends and visits the student at his school and beats him in the school toilets. The vicious student retaliates by murdering the young boy. A bleak story of revenge.

results.title: Gang related
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Brad Krevoy, Steve Stabler, John Bertolli and Jim Kouf
results.brief_description: Notorious for being rapper turned actor Tupac Shakur’s final film appearance before being gunned down in 1996, ‘Gang related’ is a tense crime drama about corruption, gangs and drugs. Detectives Divinci (James Belushi) and Rodriguez (Tupac Shakur) are two bent street detectives with a flourishing byline drug scam which involves Divinci’s girlfriend, Cynthia (Lela Rochon) as bait. The partners have vastly different motivations behind their actions - Divinci wants to retire while Rodriguez has a gambling debt to repay. Both are united by their belief that the men they kill deserve it. Their plan quickly unravels when one of the punters turns out to be an undercover D.E.A. and they are not able to wash their hands as cleanly for the murder with their usual “gang-related” dismissal. Cast also includes James Earl Jones, David Paymer and Wendy Crewson. Includes bonus footage including the last ever interview with Tupac Shakur.

results.title: Gandhi and the end of an Empire
results.creator_credit: Vision 7, Gaumont-British Instructional and Gilles Delannoy
results.brief_description: An informative documentary about Mahatma Gandhi and the important role he played in India’s passage towards independence from British rule. Discusses Gandhi’s life, his beliefs and his aspirations for a united India where Hindus and Muslims live in peace and harmony and where his theories of non-violence and non-cooperation will lead to autonomy and independence. Also provides an indepth look at India’s history from the turn of the century through to Gandhi’s assassination in 1948 discussing the tenets of the Hindu religion; the diversity that exists within India in relation to language, culture and religion; the caste system; the strategies devised by Gandhi to break Britain’s control of India; the violence and bloodshed associated with the independence movement and these divisions; the appointment of Jawaharlal Nehru as leader of the Indian Congress Party; the formation of Pakistan; Britain’s withdrawal from India; India’s independence. Uses archival film footage, stills and newsreels. Narrated by Michel Pascal. Teacher Notes are included. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Gandhi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, International Film Investors, National Film Development Corporation of India, Goldcrest Films, Indo-British Films Ltd and Richard Attenborough
results.brief_description: An epic account of Mahatma Gandhi’s lifelong struggle against British Imperialism in India, tracing his life from 1919 to his assassination in 1948. Filmed on a lavish scale mixing biography, history and adventure, Ben Kingsley’s gives an insightful performance as Gandhi. Co-starring Candice Bergen, Edward Fox, Sir John Gielgud, Martin Sheen, John Mills and Trevor Howard.

results.title: Gandhi's India
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes the life of Mahatma Gandhi, his policies and ideals and his influence on India’s progress towards independence. The film also considers how his views are related to Indian life in the 1960’s. Narrated by Alec Guinness.

results.title: Gandhi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Traces Gandhi’s rise to power in India and his struggles to win independence for his country, terminating in his assassination on January 30, 1948. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Gamlet = Hamlet
results.brief_description:
In this Russian version of Shakespeare’s play the Prince of Denmark is no vacillating dreamer but, like everything else in the film, muscular and volatile. A radical adaptation of Shakespeare, this version of Hamlet upset the purists with its bold interpretation of the play. Hamlet delivers one of theatre’s most famous soliloquies - ‘To be or not to be’ - with his back to the camera. The images, enriched by the dramatic Shostakovitch music, are bold, sweeping and powerful. Filmed in location in Estonia, the majestic castle is symbolic of Hamlet’s torture, trapped in the quagmire of his quest to avenge his father’s death. In Russian with English subtitles. Also available in 16mm.

Credits: Director, writer, Grigorii Kozintsev ; photography, Jonas Gritsyus ; music, Dmitrii Shostakovitch ; editing, Ye Makhankova.
Cast: Anastasia Vertinskay, Innokenty Smoktunovsky, Mikhail Nazvanov, Elza Radzina, Yuri Tolubeyev, Vadim Medvedev.

results.title: Games: the Philippines
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows a variety of games played by Filipino children as well as toys made by them. Includes the indigenous and English names for the games. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Games of the XXI Olympiad: Montreal 1976
results.creator_credit: Ashley Murray, ONF | NFB, Jean Beaudin, Marcel Carriere and Georges Dufaux
results.brief_description: The official film of the Games of the XXI Olympiad, Montreal, 1976. A unique special for world television audiences, it probes behind the scenes, capturing the emotional dimensions of the athlete and his or her sport. It highlights certain teams and participants, before, during and after their events. This film approaches each event with the intention of revealing the athlete as an individual.
